title: US troops return to Qatar base, Iran reopens airspace: Trump's strike on Tehran called off?
content: US aircraft are returning to Qatar's Al Udeid base as security alerts are lowered, following President Trump's indication of easing Iran's protest crackdown. Iran reopened its airspace after a temporary closure due to fears of US military action. While tensions appear to have eased, the situation remains uncertain.

title: Maha triumph for BJP? Exit polls forecast Mahayuti sweep in BMC; Thackerays may stumble
content: Exit polls project a significant victory for the Mahayuti alliance in the BMC polls, with projections indicating they will surpass 130 seats. The Shiv Sena (UBT)–MNS alliance is expected to secure just over 60 seats, falling short of expectations. The elections saw nearly 50% voter turnout across Mumbai and 28 other municipal corporations in Maharashtra.

title: Gates Foundation shut down begins: $9bn outlay, 500 jobs to go; closure set for 2045
content: Bill Gates is initiating the phased closure of his influential foundation by 2045, with a record $9 billion budget planned for 2026. The organization will cut up to 500 staff positions over five years to manage operating costs.

title: WPL: Day after being retired out, Harleen Deol guides UP Warriorz to victory
content: Harleen Deol's unbeaten 64 guided UP Warriorz to their first WPL 2026 win, defeating defending champions Mumbai Indians by seven wickets. Deol's stellar performance anchored the chase after Mumbai's Nat Sciver-Brunt's 65 had earlier propelled them to 161 for five. UPW sealed the target with seven wickets in hand.

title: When 'Bazball' intent met conservatism: England's Ashes autopsy
content: England’s Ashes defeat in Australia was shaped as much by selection conservatism as on-field execution. Like India before them, they prioritised batting depth over wicket-taking firepower, rarely playing four frontline fast bowlers.

title: 'Stop coding': Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to engineers; says this is what they should do instead
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: Jim Leonhard rising as Cowboys' top defensive coordinator choice
content: The Dallas Cowboys are targeting Jim Leonhard as their next defensive coordinator, aiming to strengthen a below-average defense while Dak Prescott is in his prime. Leonhard’s rapid rise in college and the NFL, including a Broyles Award finalist nod and promotion under Sean Payton, makes him the standout candidate. Dallas is patiently waiting for him to become available.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Defamation case filed against Khushi Mukherjee over Suryakumar claim
content: Social media influencer Faizan Ansari has filed a Rs 100 crore defamation case against actress Khushi Mukherjee on January 13, following her remarks about Indian T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav. The legal action comes after Mukherjee claimed in an earlier interview that Suryakumar “used to message me a lot.”

title: CBSE orders schools to disclose teacher strength: Why India’s ‘comfortable’ PTR tells only half story
content: CBSE has told its affiliated schools to stop treating staffing as a backroom file. By February 15, 2026, they must put teacher details and qualifications on their websites under Mandatory Public Disclosure, with the board warning that gaps or errors can invite action under affiliation rules. The timing is telling: India’s PTR can look comfortable in national averages, but state-wise spikes and single-teacher schools reveal how unevenly teachers are actually spread.

title: Patrick Mahomes stays low-key as Brittany Mahomes marks milestone amid recovery doubts
content: Patrick Mahomes is staying largely out of the public eye as he continues his rehab following a season-ending knee injury. While his recovery timeline remains uncertain, his wife Brittany recently shared a family milestone, drawing attention to the quieter phase of Mahomes’ career as he balances healing, home life, and preparation for his return.

title: IShowSpeed net worth timeline: How Darren Watkins Jr built his fortune
content: Darren Watkins Jr, known as IShowSpeed, transformed from a young gamer into a global streaming sensation. His earnings grew steadily from YouTube ads to music, tours, and brand deals.  Starting with minimal income, his net worth surged significantly between 2020 and 2026, reaching an estimated $35-40 million.  He maintains a private personal life.

title: LeBron James’ two-word message honors Kyle Lowry’s Toronto homecoming
content: Toronto Raptors fans gave a heartfelt standing ovation to former star Kyle Lowry during his return, even as his 76ers team secured a win.  LeBron James lauded the touching sportsmanship with a social media post. Lowry, who spent nine years with the Raptors, called the moment a career highlight, cherishing the team's gesture.

title: Honey Singh issues apology after viral Delhi concert clip sparks outrage
content: Rapper and music producer Yo Yo Honey Singh has issued a public apology after a video from his recent stage appearance in Delhi went viral, sparking widespread criticism over a sexually explicit remark. In a video statement shared on his official social media handle, Honey Singh apologised to those who felt offended by his words and acknowledged that his language may have crossed a line.

title: Bangladesh cricket crisis: BPL at risk; players demand public apology from BCB director
content: Cricketers' Welfare Association of Bangladesh (CWAB) stated players will return to cricket if BCB director M Najmul Islam issues a public apology and his removal process progresses. Players reconsidered their boycott, citing the impact on national teams and the importance of the Bangladesh Premier League.

title: Tyreek Hill’s 'I want to go home' tweet sparks Falcons, Chiefs speculation
content: Tyreek Hill’s recent “I want to go home” comment has sparked speculation about his 2026 destination. As a Georgia native, a return to the Falcons seems possible, but his first NFL home, the Chiefs, also looms as a potential landing spot. Injury concerns, age, and off-field issues make his next move uncertain, leaving both teams’ fans guessing.

title: Is Linus Ullmark’s future with the Senators in doubt amid trade rumours?
content: Ottawa Senators goalie Linus Ullmark is on personal leave, fueling trade rumors. General Manager Steve Staios denies these claims, stating Ullmark's absence is personal and the team supports him. Despite the denials, speculation continues as the Senators navigate their playoff push and goaltending changes. Ullmark's past Vezina win adds to the intrigue surrounding his current situation.

title: Bird poop halts India Open match; contradicts BAI's claims of 'clean' arena
content: Bird droppings disrupted play at the India Open badminton tournament for the second consecutive day. Following a monkey sighting, the men's singles match between HS Prannoy and Loh Kean Yew was halted twice due to droppings falling from the stadium ceiling. This incident echoes earlier concerns about venue conditions raised by Danish players.

title: Army Day: Indigenous weapons take centre stage; Gen Dwivedi outlines future war readiness
content: The Indian Army is transforming into a future-ready force. A key focus is on indigenous equipment, now deemed a strategic necessity. Soldiers are becoming more capable through technology and modern equipment. New units are being formed to meet future war challenges. The Army is also prioritizing research and development for domestic manufacturing and repair capabilities.

title: BMC election result 2026: When and where to watch live counting - all you need to know
content: Vote counting for the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections begins today, determining control of Asia's richest civic body after over six years. Exit polls project a strong performance for the ruling Mahayuti alliance, potentially crossing 130 seats, while the Shiv Sena (UBT)–MNS alliance is expected to trail.

title: The Boomerang risk: How Trump's 'help' could save Khamenei's regime in Iran
content: History suggests outside military pressure often ends up rescuing Tehran. Even the prospect of US or Israeli strikes can redirect public anger away from regime misrule and toward sheer national survival, splinter protest alliances, and give authorities cover for a far harsher crackdown. At a time when Iran’s leadership is fighting to reassert control, foreign force could deliver its most potent weapon: nationalism.

title: Watch: US seizes another oil tanker; 4th such op since Maduro capture
content: US forces intercepted the oil tanker Veronica in the Caribbean as part of an operation to control Venezuelan oil shipments. This seizure, conducted under Operation Southern Spear, marks the latest move in a campaign to dismantle a "ghost fleet" and enforce sanctions, with officials stating oil leaving Venezuela must be coordinated lawfully.

title: Grizzlies vs Magic injury report, key absences and matchup stats
content: History is made as the Memphis Grizzlies face the Orlando Magic in Germany's inaugural NBA regular-season game on January 15, 2026. Both teams, battling for playoff spots, will see key players sidelined due to injuries. Orlando, with a more stable roster, holds a slight advantage, aiming to build separation in the East.

title: Deepak Tijori files complaint after being cheated in film funding scam
content: A case has been registered against three persons for allegedly cheating Bollywood actor and filmmaker Deepak Tijori of Rs 2.5 lakh on the pretext of arranging funds for his upcoming film, a police official said on Thursday, as reported by PTI.

title: 'Attempted to flee': Coast guard intercepts Pakistani fishing vessel in Arabian Sea - Watch
content: An Indian Coast Guard ship intercepted a Pakistani fishing vessel, Al-Madina, with nine crew members, found operating within Indian waters near the International Maritime Boundary Line. The vessel attempted to flee towards Pakistan when challenged but was successfully intercepted and boarded. The boat is now being towed to Porbandar for further investigation.

title: Suicide, heart attack: Two deaths in West Bengal 'linked' to SIR; kin cite anxiety
content: Two individuals, a booth-level officer and a senior citizen, have died in West Bengal, with families alleging links to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls.  Growing anxiety over the exercise has reportedly led to multiple deaths and illnesses across the state, prompting concerns from the Chief Minister.

title: B'desh cricket in turmoil: 'Embarrassing & deeply disappointing'- star player slams BCB
content: Bangladesh all-rounder Mehidy Hasan Miraz expressed deep disappointment over BCB director M Nazmul Islam's recent comments, which he believes fuel a misleading narrative about player compensation and disrespect the team's efforts. Miraz emphasized that player earnings are generated through performance and participation in tournaments, not from taxpayers' money, highlighting the financial realities of the sport.

title: 'Insurrection Act': Trump threatens to deploy military to quash anti-ICE stirs
content: President Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minnesota following a federal agent-involved shooting and subsequent protests. The incident, which saw protesters clashing with law enforcement, further escalated tensions in the city. The Insurrection Act allows the president to deploy military forces domestically under specific circumstances.

title: Bulldozers clearing bodies from streets: Iranians in India reveal horror of deadly protests
content: Reports from Iran paint a grim picture: overflowing hospitals, streets cleared by earthmovers, and families charged for their children's bullets. Protests have morphed into a struggle for survival, with citizens facing severe economic hardship and brutal crackdowns. Iranians abroad are raising their voices, seeking support and highlighting the dire situation back home.

title: Shortened ISL gets AFC approval, but Indian clubs lose direct entry to ACL slots
content: Because of the delayed start to the season, Indian clubs will not be able to complete the mandatory 24 matches — across the top-tier league and domestic cup — required for direct entry into AFC club competitions.

title: Govt offices attacked during SIR hearings in West Bengal
content: After attack on the BDO office at Farakka in Murshidabad district on Wednesday, thousands of locals vandalised BDO office at Chakulia in Uttar Dinajpur district

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Young voters left confused over new alliances in Mumbai
content: Trends indicate the BJP has slowly increased its hold in the BMC, traditionally dominated by the Thackerays

title: Punjab CM Mann appears before Akal Takht Secretariat to clarify remarks on Sikh traditions
content: Before appearing before the Takht Secretariat, where he was present for more than an hour, Mr. Mann offered prayers at the Golden Temple

title: India planning evacuation of nationals from Iran: Official sources
content: Iran had temporarily closed its airspace on January 14, but reopened it on January 15, which has increased the chances of India sending aircraft to Tehran

title: Tripura CM ready to accept Roman script for Kokborok language, Tipra Motha claims
content: Tipra Motha leaders said CM Manik Saha confirmed the State government’s readiness to introduce the Roman script in all levels of examinations under the Tripura Board of Secondary Education (TBSE), CBSE and ICSE

title: Can’t we presume that voters who survived multiple roll revisions are citizens, Supreme Court poses petitioners’ query to ECI
content: The question from the CJI-led Bench came in the backdrop of discussions over a 1995 Supreme Court case law, which held that a person already enrolled in the voter list should not be asked to prove citizenship

title: A.R. Rahman says Hindi film industry has changed over past eight years: ‘It could be a communal thing’
content: A.R. Rahman said he was the first composer from the South who went to the Hindi film industry and survived it

title: Maharashtra civic polls: In battle for Mumbai, exit polls predict clear win for BJP-Shiv Sena alliance
content: The Shiv Sena (UBT) and the MNS, which contested polls independently, are expected to win five and two seats, respectively in the BMC polls.

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026: When theatre moved beyond borders
content: The High School drama competiton at the State School Art Festival hit hard with tales of conflict and compassion and conscience in front of a full house

title: ‘Murder’ of democracy: Opposition claims irregularities in Maharashtra civic polls
content: Polling for 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra on January 15 drew sharp political reactions, with Mumbai’s high-stakes BMC contest at the centre. Opposition parties alleged voting irregularities, including concerns over indelible ink, voter lists and polling procedures, while election authorities rejected the claims and said complaints were being examined.

title: U.S. seizes Venezuela-linked tanker ahead of Trump-Machado meeting
content: The seizure ​marks the sixth vessel targeted in recent weeks that was either carrying Venezuelan oil or had done so in the past. The officials, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said the seizure took place in the Caribbean

title: Barabanki MP says Uttar Pradesh SIRs show rural voters exceed total number of voters in State; SC asks Election Commission to explain
content: ‘After the Assembly SIR, the total number of voters in U.P. is shown as 12.56 crore, reflecting a reduction of about 2.89 crore voters. After the Panchayat SIR, the number of rural voters alone is shown as 12.69 crore, reflecting an increase of about 40 lakh voters,’ the note read

title: Odisha’s Sundargarh clash: Educational institutes shut on Jan. 16 as curbs imposed, internet suspended; at least 12 injured
content: The DIG of Odisha Police informed that the clash erupted around 2.30 p.m. over dispute on some “food item” and the situation remained under control since 5 p.m

title: Democracy delivers in India as people are at centre of governance, says PM Modi
content: About 61 speakers and presiding officers from 42 Commonwealth nations are attending the CSPOC which is being hosted by India for the fourth time

title: AI, emerging tech have increased efficiency of democracy, says Om Birla; cautions against misuse
content: The Lok Sabha Speaker said the use of AI and digital technologies was steadily increasing in the Parliament and State Legislatures

title: Top EU leaders to visit India as Republic Day guests; likely to sign trade deal
content: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says both sides very close to EU-India trade deal, “sensitive agricultural” items to be left out

title: Watch: The making of ‘atchu vellam’, an ingredient in sweet Pongal
content: Veeramangudi, in Papanasam taluk of Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur district, is known for its production of the soft and crumbly atchu vellam (jaggery set into cubical wooden moulds). Factories in and around the village produce approximately 245 tonnes of jaggery (7,000 bags of 35 kg each) annually. Of late though, these factories have started closing down due to an attack of yellow leaf disease in the sugarcane crop.

title: Panic grips Kashmiri parents as wards go incommunicado after Iran internet shutdown, street protests
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Students Association (JKSA) claimed that the first batch of students is likely to return to India on Friday (January 16, 2026)

title: Watch: Pongal celebrations light up Pudukottai
content: Residents of Meivazhi Salai in Tamil Nadu’s Pudukkottai district came together to celebrate the Pongal festival with joy, tradition and community spirit on Thursday. From festive decorations to ritual cooking of Pongal, the harvest festival reflected gratitude, unity and cultural pride.

title: 52 Maoists carrying ₹1.41 crore as reward surrender in Bijapur
content: As part of the rehabilitation process, immediate financial assistance of ₹50,000 was provided to each cadre as an incentive

title: Deal with U.S. ‘very near’, teams are engaging virtually on pending issues: Commerce Secretary
content: The latest trade data, released on January 15, 2026, showed that India’s merchandise exports to the U.S. stood at a five-month high of $7.01 billion in December 2025, up from $6.89 in December 2024

title: Bengal SIR: Election Commission declines proposal to accept Class 10 admit card as valid document
content: The ECI noted that in accordance with the instructions issued on October 27, 2025, the madhyamik admit card is not recognised as a valid document for verification purposes

title: ‘Serious indictment’ of Mamata: BJP over Supreme Court observation on ED plea in I-PAC raid caseami
content: Supreme court stayed the FIR filed in West Bengal against ED officials who raided the I-PAC office and the residence of its director, Pratik Jain, on January 8, 2026 and directed the State police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.

title: Watch: How Tamil Nadu celebrated Pongal
content: Tamil Nadu erupted in festive joy on January 15 as across the state celebrated ‘Thai Pongal’, the traditional harvest festival, with religious fervour and gaiety.

title: We are preparing for future wars; indigenisation key for self-reliance: Army Chief
content: General Dwivedi said that special emphasis is being placed on resources that are useful for both military and civilian purposes, contributing to the overall development of the country

title: Exports rise 1.87% to $38.5 billion in December: Commerce Secretary
content: Despite global uncertainties, India's exports are recording positive growth, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal says

title: Air India aircraft grounded after engine ingests cargo container; DGCA launches probe
content: The aircraft was operating a New Delhi–New York flight and returned to Delhi shortly after departure due to Iranian airspace restrictions

title: Uddhav Thackeray claims irregularities in Maharashtra civic polls, calls it 'murder' of democracy
content: The former Chief Minister also demanded the suspension of the State Election Commissioner over alleged irregularities in the municipal corporation polls

title: Omar speaks to Jaishankar on J&K students caught in Iran turmoil
content: The parents of Kashmiri students studying in Iran have appealed to the Centre to bring their children back amid the ongoing tensions

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea to withdraw life-sustaining treatment for Harish Rana
content: The hearing highlighted the importance of the family taking a “consistent and well-considered” decision

title: CBI conducts searches in various parts of Kolkata in bank fraud case
content: The searches were being conducted at the residence of a businessman in the city's New Alipore area, and in New Town near the city, among other places, they said

title: BSP to contest all elections alone, including 2027 U.P. Assembly polls: Mayawati
content: There should be no confusion about this. The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) will contest the next Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh alone, says BSP president Mayawati

title: Want to affix your nameplate: Kharge to PM on Manikarnika Ghat redevelopment
content: Protestors have opposed a demolition drive under the redevelopment plan of the Manikarnika Ghat and alleged damage to a century-old idol of Ahilyabai Holkar, a charge refuted by the district administration

title: Supreme Court stays Kolkata Police probe into ED officers, says ‘lawlessness’ may creep into other States
content: A Bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Vipul Pancholi said they intend to issue notice and examine the matter. “This is a very serious matter; we will issue a notice. We have to examine it,” it remarked orally.

title: Mehbooba Mufti wants Centre's intervention for safe return of students from Iran
content: According to estimates, a little over 10,000 Indians, including students, are currently living in Iran

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Opposition raises concerns over marker pens used instead of indelible ink, BMC to probe complaints
content: The ink on the finger after voting can be removed with a sanitiser. Instead of ink, pens are being used after voting, says Maharashta Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray

title: Two sports trainees found dead in hostel in Kerala
content: The reason for the deaths is yet to be ascertained; police will record statements from other sportspersons in the hostel, their trainers and relatives, an official said

title: Highlights: 4 Exit Polls Predict Sweep For BJP-Led Coalition In Mumbai Civic Body BMC Election
content: Maharashtra Elections 2026 Voting Day Highlights: Voting across 29 municipal corporations was held across Maharashtra. A total of 3.48 crore voters were eligible to decide the fate of 15,931 candidates.

title: In Top Court, Priya Kapur Seeks Details Of Karisma Kapoor Divorce Settlement
content: Priya Kapur, the second wife of the late industrialist Sunjay Kapur, has appealed to the Supreme Court, seeking certified copies of the divorce proceedings between Karisma and Sunjay Kapur that took place in 2016.

title: 233 People In 1 House? Residents Flag 'Error' In Gorakhpur Draft Voter List
content: There is a 'house' in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur where 233 people live, according to data captured during the draft special intensive revision (SIR) exercise. The residents include families from different communities including Hindu, Muslim and Sikh.

title: Lawyer Assaulted By Toll Plaza Staff Over Payment Related Issue In UP: Cops
content: Three toll plaza employees were detained for allegedly assaulting a lawyer following a minor altercation on the Lucknow-"Sultanpur highway in Barabanki, police said on Thursday.

title: 'Silver' Medals Gifted To Retired Railway Staff. They Were Made Of Copper
content: A disturbing fraud has surfaced inside the Indian Railways' system after gold-plated "silver" coins given to retiring employees as a mark of honour were found to be fake.

title: 5 Expelled After Assamese Student Assaulted In Madhya Pradesh Hostel
content: A 22-year-old postgraduate student from Assam was allegedly assaulted by five peers at Indira Gandhi National Tribal University (IGNTU) hostel at Amarkantak in Madhya Pradesh's Anuppur district.

title: "Quite The Opposite": US Senator On Reports Of Trump Not Attacking Iran
content: US Senator Lindsey Graham, whom President Donald Trump considers to be a "wonderful friend", has claimed that reports suggesting the US does not intend to attack Iran are "inaccurate" and further said that the situation is quite the opposite.

title: Woman Dies By Suicide After Fight With Mother-In-Law Over Ghee: Cops
content: A woman allegedly died by suicide in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district on Thursday after a dispute with her mother-in-law over ghee, a police official said.

title: Marathi Manoos With Them, But Thackerays Set to Lose Mumbai Election: Exit Polls
content: Around 20 days ago, cousins Uddhav and Raj Thackeray formally declared a reunion for the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), after a 20-year estrangement.

title: Police Versus Media Over Arrest of Journalists In Telangana
content: Tension between the Telangana state administration and some sections of the media reached a boiling point on Wednesday following the late-night detention of three journalists from a prominent Telugu news outlet, NTV.

title: Drones Spotted In Jammu And Kashmir Again, Third Time In Five Days
content: The army fired at drones that were spotted in the Jammu and Poonch sectors this evening, defence sources said. This was the third drone sighting in Jammu and Kashmir in five days.

title: Hit By Kite String, Couple, Daughter Fall 70 Feet Off Surat Flyover, Killed
content: A family of three fell from a 70-foot-high flyover in Gujarat's Surat district after a kite string disbalanced their two-wheeler on Wednesday.

title: India Preparing To Facilitate Return Of Indians From Iran: Sources
content: In view of the evolving situation in Iran, the Ministry of External Affairs is making preparations to facilitate the return of Indian nationals who wish to travel back to India.

title: Delhi Records Over 9,000 Deaths Due To Respiratory Diseases In 2024
content: The national capital recorded 9,211 deaths due to respiratory diseases in 2024, up from 8,801 in 2023, continuing an upward trend seen over the past few years, according latest official data released by the Delhi government.

title: US Sanctions Iranian Officials Over Protest Crackdown, Oil Money Laundering
content: The United States imposed sanctions Thursday on Iranian security officials and financial networks, accusing them of orchestrating a violent crackdown on peaceful protests and laundering billions in oil revenues.

title: Moody's Upgrades Ratings Of Adani Group Firms To Stable From Negative
content: Moody's Ratings on Thursday upgraded the outlook on Adani Transmission Step-One Ltd (ATSOL) and Adani Electricity Mumbai Ltd (AEML) to stable from negative.

title: 'Death Threats, Vandalism By Kuki Insurgents': Naga Body Files Police Case In Manipur
content: A village authority of the Naga tribes in Manipur has filed a police case alleging death threats and vandalism by insurgents of the Kuki National Front (KNF) in their village in Kangpokpi district, 45 km from the state capital Imphal.

title: Water Contamination A Public Health Emergency: Bhopal Green Tribunal
content: The contamination of drinking water supply in Madhya Pradesh is a systemic environmental and public health emergency, the National Green Tribunal in Bhopal has declared.

title: Bihar Woman, Her 3 Kids Found Dead 5 Days After They Went Missing
content: Police on Thursday recovered the bodies of a woman and her three children, five days after they went missing in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district, officials said.

title: Authorities Killed Canadian Citizen In Iran, Says Foreign Minister
content: A Canadian citizen has died in Iran at the hands of the Iranian authorities, Foreign Minister Anita Anand said.

title: Patrick and Brittany Mahomes surprise Randi: 'Felt so loved' in family moment
content: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes surprised Randi Mahomes with an emotional early 50th birthday celebration during the NFL offseason. The gathering took place at Mahomes’ Kansas City restaurant, 1587 Prime, and included Jackson Mahomes and close family members. Randi later shared that she felt incredibly loved and grateful for the unexpected moment.

title: BMC exit polls: Axis My India predicts clean sweep for BJP-led Mahayuti
content: Axis My India's exit poll projects a significant win for the BJP-led NDA in the BMC elections, potentially securing 131-151 of 227 seats. The election, held after a nine-year delay, saw a turnout of 46-50% and was marked by controversy over indelible ink allegations.

title: IND vs NZ: 'Not doing a lot'- India coach throws Nitish Reddy under the bus
content: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate acknowledged Nitish Kumar Reddy's struggle to impress despite opportunities, while noting Rohit Sharma's lack of recent match practice. The team might have misjudged conditions, potentially needing an extra spinner. KL Rahul's strong form offers batting order flexibility, and Ravindra Jadeja's bowling is deemed improving despite recent wicket scarcity.

title: Iran crisis: US carrier strike group moves towards Middle East; tensions flare
content: Amidst escalating US-Iran tensions and widespread protests in Iran, a US carrier strike group is being redeployed from the South China Sea to the Middle East. This significant military shift coincides with Washington deliberating various options against Tehran, while regional neighbours express concerns about instability.  US personnel in Qatar have been advised to leave as a precaution.

title: Indian Army stands as steadfast shield of nation: Kharge
content: On Indian Army Day, we bow in reverence and gratitude to our brave soldiers, veterans, ex-servicemen and their families, says Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge

title: President Murmu, PM Modi hail Indian armed forces personnel on Army Day
content: PM Modi said the country remembers with deep respect those who have laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: At least five killed, ten injured in van-tractor collision in Bhopal
content: A pickup van headed for Narmadapuram and the tractor trolley collided head-on, Berasia police station inspector in-charge Vijendra Sen said

title: Voting across 29 Maharashtra civic bodies complete amid row over ink removal from fingers
content: Around 50% polling recorded, as per State Election Commissioner; vote count will take place on January 16

title: How are cryptocurrency exchanges in India vetting customers? | Explained
content: Cryptocurrency exchanges in India use a range of methods to verify their customers and prevent money-laundering and the financing of terrorism

title: Air India, IndiGo international flights impacted by Iran airspace closure
content: Air India said in a statement that some flights where currently rerouting is not possible are being cancelled

title: Maharashtra civic polls updates: Voting complete amid row over removing 'indelible' ink; voter turnout around 50%, SEC says
content: Maharashtra SEC Dinesh Waghmare said viral videos showing people removing ink from their fingers after casting vote are under investigation

title: Uproar as rats roam near beds, oxygen pipes in Gonda Hospital; Opposition raises concern for patient safety
content: With the video going viral, the Opposition alleged that the health infrastructure in the State is in a shambles

title: City coughs, sputters, as Bhogi fires burn; 4 stations record poor air quality
content: TNPCB data showed that in the 24 hours ending 8 a.m. on Tuesday, four stations out of 15, registered poor air quality

title: Villagers in Odisha seek restoration of land as thermal power plant fails to take off
content: They alleged corporate went into liquidation and right to transfer land parcels was given to another company without taking them into confidence

title: Bihar Chief Secretary makes geo-spatial approval mandatory for DPRs of infra projects above ₹50 crore
content: Departments were instructed to incorporate geo-spatial inputs at the planning stage itself to avoid technical, administrative, and land-related obstacles at later stages.

title: Indore water contamination: Medical panel pegs death toll at 15
content: The panel, consisting of five doctors from the government-run Mahatma Gandhi Medical (MGM) College, has submitted a report to the State authorities confirming 15 deaths even as the official figure remains at six

title: Political parties make pitch for 2027 Punjab election at Maghi Mela
content: AAP govt. will make provision in budget to give ₹1,000 per month to every woman, says Mann; Akali Dal chief lists poll promises; BJP holds first independent political rally at annual gathering

title: Suvendu warns West Bengal CM of legal action over coal scam remarks
content: In a post on X, the Leader of the Opposition claimed that the deadline given to Mamata Banerjee to respond to a defamation notice served by him had expired

title: Tej Pratap urges younger brother Tejashwi Yadav to merge RJD into his party
content: He said this on the occasions of Dahi-Chura feast which he has organised at his residence in Patna. Even his father and RJD Chief Lalu Prasad also attended the feast who had once expelled him from the party and snapped even family ties with him.

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | From melody to motion, students dazzle on festival stage
content: The 64th State School Arts Festival opens in Thrissur with dazzling performances by high school girls in the light music contest, alongside Mohiniyattam, group dance, and myriad art forms. Thousands of participants and spectators celebrate the talent, culture, and rich artistic heritage.

title: Union Minister welcomes INSV Kaundinya crew at Muscat port
content: Azzan Al Busaidi, under secretary, Tourism, Ministry of Heritage and Tourism of Oman, along with senior dignitaries from the Indian Navy, Royal Navy of Oman, Royal Oman Police Coast Guard, and other ministries were present.

title: Lokayukta registers case over large-scale government land scam in Nagamangala taluk
content: The accused include serving and former government officials and private individuals. A  criminal case has been registered against 11 persons in connection with the scam, and five government officials have been arrested.

title: Conditions favourable for cessation of NE monsoon; fog to continue in A.P.
content: Except for two, districts in Andhra Pradesh have either recorded excess or normal rainfall during south-west and north-east monsoon seasons

title: Centre asks A.P. to expand PPP model to ensure better healthcare services
content: State Health Secretary receives a letter containing suggestions in key areas of nuclear medicine, radiology, cancer daycare centres, dental clinics and mobile medical units

title:
Mumbai model to help build 
self-financing cities in Andhra Pradesh
content: A delegation from the State, during a recent two-day tour, studied advanced practices in regional governance, land-based financing, transit-oriented development and slum redevelopment in Mumbai Metropolitan Region

title: BSF, ITBP and NIA get new chiefs
content: Shatrujeet Singh Kapoor for ITBP, Praveen Kumar for BSF and Rakesh Aggarwal for NIA were proposed by the Home Ministry

title: Cancellation of session on Babur at Bhopal Lit Fest draws criticism for BJP government in M.P.
content: BLF co-organiser Abhilash Khandekar told The Hindu that police teams had visited the venue on January 9 and 10, advising the organising body to cancel the session fearing that some fringe elements may disrupt the Fest

title: TET results sparks concern among in-service teachers, unions seek exemption
content: Test outcome triggers a debate, with teacher unions arguing that when more than half of the teachers fail to qualify, it clearly indicates that the examination does not reflect classroom teaching competencies

title: Australia classifies Indian students ‘high-risk’, tightens visa scrutiny
content: It improves quality over quantity, say experts; this means requiring detailed financial proof, full traceability of source of funds, a strict ‘Genuine Student’ assessment, which may include interviews, and slower and manual checks of documentation

title: 29 Maharashtra civic bodies go to polls; Mumbai is big prize
content: More than 3.48 crore voters will cast their votes to choose 2,869 corporators from among 15,908 candidates; Votes will be counted on January 16

title: Uncontested victories in Mumbai local polls valid under the law: Bombay High Court
content: The opposition claimed that mass withdrawals were not ‘voluntary’ and Mahayuti allies used coercion, forcing candidates to withdraw

title: Cong leader booked for threatening and abusing Municipal Commissioner
content: The Congress leader threatened the Municipal Commissioner over a flex and banner to promote Kannada film Cult that was removed for violating norms

title: Nipah-hit Bengal nurses critical; two contacts hospitalised
content: One nurse is in coma and the other is on ventilator support; 120 people who came into contact with them have been directed to isolate themselves; State govt. launches helpline to guide public

title: Meitei, Kuki-Zo insurgent groups warned against violating ground rules, continuing extortion
content: MHA, State officials conduct joint review of insurgent groups; UNLF-P, a Meitei group, asked to return looted weapons to police armouries; Kuki-Zo groups asked to relocate seven camps, enforce ground rules

title: KIIFB model should be modernised to turbocharge State’s infrastructure development, says Thomas Isaac
content: Kerala’s new developmental phase can be meaningfully realised by preparing and implementing an action plan focused on a knowledge economy that builds upon the advances made in education, says former Finance Minister

title: UGC brings out new rules against caste discrimination
content: Higher education institutions may lose recognition if they violate the regulations; UGC brings OBCs under the ambit of new rules after their exclusion in the draft version evoked criticism; commission drops proposal to impose penalty for false complaint

title: 'What did I do, man?' How James Nnaji set off a college hoops controversy
content: The first men's player to be drafted then cleared by the NCAA sent shock waves through the sport. Here's how and why.

title: 20 charged in college hoops point-shaving plot
content: Twenty men, including many former college basketball players, have been charged in a point-shaving scheme that involved 29 games being fixed, according to a federal indictment.

title: Sources: Kuminga demands trade from Warriors
content: Warriors forward Jonathan Kuminga has demanded a trade away from Golden State, league sources told ESPN.

title: Rory: LIV not signing anyone who moves needle
content: Even if LIV Golf spends hundreds of millions of dollars to re-sign two-time U.S. Open winner Bryson DeChambeau, PGA Tour star Rory McIlroy doesn't believe the Saudi Arabian-financed breakaway league will be any better off.

title: Kershaw set to pitch in World Baseball Classic
content: Despite retiring from pitching after helping the Los Angeles Dodgers win a second straight World Series title, Clayton Kershaw has committed to pitch in the World Baseball Classic.

title: Sources: Giants finalizing deal with Harbaugh
content: While contract numbers are still being finalized, John Harbaugh is ready to accept the Giants' head coaching job and the team is expected to hire him as soon as possible, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Commanders to hire son of Doug Williams
content: The Commanders are hiring D.J. Williams, the son of franchise great Doug Williams, to be their quarterbacks coach, the latest addition to a new-look staff under Dan Quinn.

title: Federer understands Alcaraz's 'tough' Slam chase
content: Roger Federer said he won't be the one to remind Carlos Alcaraz about how hard it is to complete a career Grand Slam.

title: 'Gold or bust' as U.S. NHL players think of Games
content: The U.S. is confident going into the Olympics despite not winning a "best-on-best" international competition at the adult level since the 1996 World Cup of Hockey or men's Games gold since the 1980 "Miracle on Ice" team.

title: 🏈 Kiper's Big Board: Ranking  NFL draft prospects
content: Mel Kiper Jr. is stacking the top 25 players for the NFL draft, starting with Fernando Mendoza. See who follows him after Dante Moore decided to return to school.

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Potential trade targets to watch for 28 NBA teams: Why two franchises don't have a candidate
content: With the NBA trade deadline looming, we evaluated the players most likely to get dealt -- and why their roster status is precarious.

title: Meet 'Dillon the villain': The NBA's biggest antagonist beloved by teammates
content: Dillon Brooks felt unwanted in Memphis but was beloved in Houston and has the Suns overachieving this season.

title: ESPN's 2025 All-America team: The top players at every position
content: From Fernando Mendoza and Jeremiyah Love to Jacob Rodriguez and Rueben Bain Jr., here are the best of the best.

title: Rams' offense flows through ... its running game? Why it's crucial to their playoff run
content: Los Angeles has the second-most-efficient run game of the past decade -- behind its 2018 ground attack.

title: Nine teams that need to turn around their seasons -- now
content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

title: Kershaw, Verlander, Scherzer: Which pitcher is this generation's true ace?
content: Three future Hall of Famers have dominated the conversation. We break down who the king of the hill is for his generation.

title: Fastest skater, hardest shot, more: The Olympics' best at every skill
content: The rosters are set, the rink is (mostly) ready. Here are the key players to watch at the 2026 Games.

title: The 2027 NFL draft class is stacked! 45 players to watch over the next 15 months
content: Dante Moore is returning to Oregon, making an already deep 2027 class that much better. Who else will scouts be watching for next year's draft?

title: Who to bet to win Super Bowl 60: Our picks after one round of the playoffs
content: Who are we betting to win the Super Bowl? Our analysts broke down the odds and the team's performances to find answers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG eye Chelsea's Enzo Fernández
content: Enzo Fernández has admirers at Paris Saint-Germain, and Atlético Madrid want Wolves' João Gomes. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Replacing Amorim was only the start: Man United have more club-defining decisions ahead
content: Questions abound for Man United: Will the Glazers take the exit clause to sell? Who will be the permanent coach? Will Rashford return? And more!

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: A new No. 1 crowned, plus a top-10 return
content: Oleksandr Usyk takes over Terence Crawford and a familiar face makes his return to the list. Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: News or noise: Breakout season on tap for Arizona's Jordan Lawlar?
content: Eric Karabell keeps tabs on the baseball world and tells you what is relevant to fantasy baseball managers.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Kon Knueppel leads the league in 3s made
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Kon Knueppel, Trae Young, Jalen Johnson and more.

title: 'Head coach' vs. 'manager': What's the difference? Does it matter?
content: the difference between the job titles of "manager" and "head coach" may seem mere semantics at first glance . but events at Manchester United and Chelsea this month point to deeper structural problems . Ruben Amorim and Enzo Maresca chose to go public with frustrations they deemed unnecessary interference from the infrastructure around them .

title: How did Steelers end up here? Should they lean into a rebuild?
content: the Steelers were blown out 30-6 by a sloppy Texans team . it was the final game of Tomlin's tenure, as he stepped down . the steelers were second in scoring defense during his first season .

title: 'How many tackles can one man break!?' Remembering Tommie Frazier and the greatest run in national title history
content: quarterback Tommie Frazier scores a touchdown in the 1996 cornhuskers' win . he ducked under a defensive end late in the third quarter of the 1995 national championship . nine Gators got a hand on Frazier, but none could bring him down .

title: J&K Police hand over ‘suspected’ pigeon to wildlife department
content: a 13-year-old boy spotted the pigeon and caught it after noticing unusual stamped markings on its feathers . on closer inspection, the bird was found wearing two coded rings on its legs . the ring on the left leg bore the name ‘Rizwan’ along with a numerical code .
